Class ChileCustomerBC


  • public class ChileCustomerBC

    ChileCustomerBC.bbj

    See Also:
    []

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      ChileCustomerBC()

      Default constructor. A business component class for customers. It can read, write and delete customers. The default constructor initializes following scopes: A (address), B (basic) and D (default - all fields)

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and TypeMethod and Description
      DataRowgetAttributesRecord()

      Returns an empty DataRow including all field attributes (like field name, editable, label etc.)

      voidremove(DataRow dr!)

      Remove a customer.

      ResultSetretrieve()

      Retrieves a ResultSet with customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selection is set, it will be used to retrieve the desired fields.

      ResultSetretrieve(BBjInt first%, BBjInt last%)

      Retrieves a ResultSet with a subset of customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selecetion are set, they will be used to retrieve the desired fields.

      voidsetFieldSelection(BBjVector fieldSelection!)

      Set a field selection to retrieve a custom set of fields. The default scope will be used if no field selection is set.

      voidsetFilter(DataRow filter!)

      Set a filter to filter the search result. The filter is used in the retrieve method. If no filter is set, the retrieve method will return all customers.

      voidsetScope(BBjString scope$)

      Set a field selection scope (A, B or D). If no or a wrong scope is set then the default scope (D) will be used.

      BBjVectorvalidateRemove(DataRow dr!)

      Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be removed. This method is internally used by the remove method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for dependencies before it can be removed.

      BBjVectorvalidateWrite(DataRow dr!)

      Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be written. This method is internally used by the write method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for required or missing data.

      DataRowwrite(DataRow dr!)

      Write/persist a customer.

    • Constructor Detail

      • ChileCustomerBC

        public ChileCustomerBC()

        Default constructor. A business component class for customers. It can read, write and delete customers. The default constructor initializes following scopes: A (address), B (basic) and D (default - all fields)

    • Method Detail

      • getAttributesRecord

        public DataRow getAttributesRecord()

        Returns an empty DataRow including all field attributes (like field name, editable, label etc.)

        Returns:
        the empty DataRow with the field attributes

      • remove

        public void remove(DataRow dr!)

        Remove a customer.

        Parameters:
        DataRow dr! a customer DataRow to be removed.
        Throws:
        an exception if the customer does not exists.
        See Also:
        #validateRemove(DataRow dr!)

      • retrieve

        public ResultSet retrieve()

        Retrieves a ResultSet with customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selection is set, it will be used to retrieve the desired fields.

        Returns:
        ResultSet a ResultSet with customer DataRows (may be empty).

      • retrieve

        public ResultSet retrieve(BBjInt first%, BBjInt last%)

        Retrieves a ResultSet with a subset of customer DataRow's. If a filter is set, this will be applied to filter the result. If a scope and/or a field selecetion are set, they will be used to retrieve the desired fields.

        Parameters:
        BBjInt first% the index of the first element in the subset (1 based)
        BBjInt last% the index of the last element in the subset.
        Returns:
        ResultSet a ResultSet with customer DataRows (may be empty).

      • setFieldSelection

        public void setFieldSelection(BBjVector fieldSelection!)

        Set a field selection to retrieve a custom set of fields. The default scope will be used if no field selection is set.

        Parameters:
        BBjVector fieldSelection! a BBjVector containing the field names for retrieving.

      • setFilter

        public void setFilter(DataRow filter!)

        Set a filter to filter the search result. The filter is used in the retrieve method. If no filter is set, the retrieve method will return all customers.

        Parameters:
        DataRow filter! a DataRow object including field names and values to filter for. Filters are AND combined.
        See Also:
        #retrieve()

      • setScope

        public void setScope(BBjString scope$)

        Set a field selection scope (A, B or D). If no or a wrong scope is set then the default scope (D) will be used.

        Parameters:
        BBjString scope$ the scope to set.

      • validateRemove

        public BBjVector validateRemove(DataRow dr!)

        Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be removed. This method is internally used by the remove method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for dependencies before it can be removed.

        Parameters:
        DataRow dr! a customer DataRow that should be removed
        Returns:
        BBjVector List with validation error messages (empty list means no validation errors).

      • validateWrite

        public BBjVector validateWrite(DataRow dr!)

        Validates a customer DataRow object before it can be written. This method is internally used by the write method. But it can also be called from the frontend to check for required or missing data.

        Parameters:
        DataRow dr! a customer DataRow that will be validated
        Returns:
        BBjVector List with validation error messages (empty list means no validation errors).

      • write

        public DataRow write(DataRow dr!)

        Write/persist a customer.

        Parameters:
        DataRow dr! a customer DataRow to be persist.
        Returns:
        DataRow the customer DataRow (may contain auto generated values/ID's)
        See Also:
        #validateWrite(DataRow dr!)
